title: Quinta Seara d'Ordens 2012 Talentus Grande Escolha Red (Douro)
description: This is a hugely dense wine, still firm with its dusty tannins and solid with concentrated black fruits. Despite all this power, the wine has style and a sense of elegance that will stand it in good stead as it matures. It is certainly not yet ready and should be aged until 2019.

title: Comm. G. B. Burlotto 2012 Monvigliero  (Barolo)
description: This opens with balsamic aromas, leather, ripe raspberry, iris and a heady whiff of pressed powder while the succulent, delicious palate delivers ripe black raspberry, cake spice and aromatic herb. Firm, polished tannins provide structure and envelope the palate. Drink 2018–2025.

title: Chappellet 2014 Signature Chenin Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: From the family that has made the variety from a three-acre block on Pritchard Hill since the 1960s, missing a few years to replant, this is such a lovely, well-composed and deliciously enjoyable wine it might induce tears of happiness, that's how good it is. Apricot, vanilla and cream surround a rounded, smooth lushness spiked in spicy nutmeg and tea.

title: Alta Colina 2013 Old 900 Syrah (Adelaida District)
description: Enhanced by 3% Viognier, this wine from Bob Tillman offers smoked meat on the nose, showing why Syrah pairs perfectly with the grill. Aromas of charred beef, charcoal and fresh-cracked black pepper lead into a palate dense with blueberry and blackberry, spiced with more pepper, soy and roasted coffee bean, and redolent with roasted-lamb flavors.

title: Elizabeth Chambers 2014 Temperance Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: This young winery continues to impress. This deep, dark, concentrated wine builds upon black cherry, vivid acids, a touch of Meyer lemon, and a powerful midpalate that unveils some gently savory notes along the way. The extended, seamless finish brings a pleasing touch of baking spices.

title: Flora Springs 2013 Trilogy Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a wow wine, supported by small amounts of Petit Verdot and Malbec. Blood orange, cranberry, cassis and raspberry provide a crisp counterpoint to the firm tannin structure, ending with grace and plenty of body, smoothly textured and refined.

title: Louis Latour 2014 Clos du Roi  (Corton)
description: At this stage, this big, black wine has an austere edge that will open out as it develops. With the powerful tannins and the density behind the ripe black fruits, it will be impressive. Drink from 2023.

title: Louis Latour 2014 Les Quatre Journaux  (Romanée-St.-Vivant)
description: A Journal is an old Burgundian measurement for just under one acre. From a portion of this Grand Cru vineyard, this wine is perfumed, powerful and has great concentration. Already it is showing dark fruits, ripe plum and good texture. Acidity cuts through the wine, giving a great lift at the end. Drink from 2022.

title: Fratelli Alessandria 2012  Barolo
description: This elegant, full-bodied wine opens with delicate scents of rose, iris and wild berry. The palate is juicy and delicious, offering ripe black cherry, crushed raspberry, grilled herb and tobacco alongside a backbone of firm, velvety tannins. Drink 2020–2028.

title: Henri de Villamont 2014  Grands-Echezeaux
description: Firm and structured, this still shows much of the ripe red fruit of the vintage. It has a round, warm feel, along with weight and density. Fresh berry flavors cut through the powerful texture. Drink from 2023.

title: Davies 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is quite a value for the quality, a stellar, medium-bodied, restrained wine that's high-toned and elusive at first aromatically. But it opens in the glass, delighting in blackberry, cherry and a burst of clove, showing skill in winemaking from a blend of vineyards, some valley floor and others mountain.

title: Domaine Coquard Loisson-Fleurot 2014  Clos de la Roche
description: For its small size, Morey Saint-Denis is blessed with four Grand Cru vineyards, of which this is arguably the finest. The wine's spice and wood flavors are still evident, although these will get well integrated into the rich red-fruit flavor. It is certainly still young and should not be drunk before 2022.

title: Vasse Felix 2012 Heytesbury Red (Margaret River)
description: This vintage, VF's flagship red is a blend of 77% Cabernet Sauvignon, 16% Malbec and 7% Petit Verdot. Although it's full-bodied and lush, it's by no means the world's biggest or ripest Cabernet blend. Instead, it's impeccably balanced and gentle, serving up cassis, vanilla and a touch of baking spices in generous swirls that reach a crescendo on the long finish. Drink now–2030.

title: Bel Colle 2012 Monvigliero  (Barolo)
description: Fragrant and loaded with finesse, this opens with scents of blue flower, rose, perfumed berry and a hint of dark spice. The bright palate delivers ripe black cherry, crushed raspberry, white pepper and cinnamon alongside tightly wound but remarkably refined tannins. Drink 2017–2022.

title: Brick House 2014 Les Dijonnais Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)
description: Happily, production of Les Dijonnais has climbed to 800 cases, while the quality remains as good as ever. This smooth and supple wine is velvety in the mouth, with flavors of raspberry, blue plum and black cherry. Its palate-pleasing thickness carries a vein of licorice and dark chocolate. Drink now through 2025.

title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2012 MR Premium Red (Alentejano)
description: A tribute to the family patriarch, José Manuel de Mello, the wine is structured and dense. It is a concentrated product from a selection of parcels, aged in new oak. Full of black-plum fruit, dark tannins as well as a firm texture, the wine is developing and will be ready from 2019.

title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2013 MR Premium Branco White (Alentejano)
description: Now mature, this is an exceptional wood-aged wine. It combines toast flavors and tropical blends so effortlessly. Spice and peaches are cut with lemon acidity. It is a blend of selected barrels from all the white varieties on the estate, making a wonderful medley of flavors. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Rui Reguinga 2014 Tributo Red (Tejo)
description: Planted on a two-acre parcel that was given to the producer by his father, this is a tribute to his memory. Produced from Rhône varietals, the wine is impressive and rich. It has dark spice, evident wood aging as well as black fruits and balanced acidity. Still young, the wine should be left to age until 2018.

title: Kynsi 2013 Nocturnum Red (Edna Valley)
description: This ode to the owls that surround the region's vineyard is a compelling mix of Pinot Noir and Grenache that offers juicy cherries and strawberries on the nose alongside smoked meat, allspice, nutmeg and a touch of caramel. The flavors are broad, inviting and rich, with black cherry, blueberry and smoked beef. It's as delicious as it is avant garde.

title: Patz & Hall 2014 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: The fruit for this wine has come from the same block of the site since 2009. Winemaker James Hall shows his ability to coax brambly flavor from a complexity of ginger spice, chocolate and generous tannin, managing to retain enough acidity to add a youthful freshness that's memorable on the finish. Drink now through 2024.

title: Tollot Beaut et Fils 2014 Les Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: A perfumed wine with red fruits, this offers dry tannins and a dense texture. With all these elements in place, the wine will develop slowly and well. Drink from 2021.

title: Sanford 2013 Sanford & Benedict Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: From the producer's iconic and historic vineyard comes this classic bottling, with red cherries, crushed brick, anise, tart plum skin, candied rose water and even a touch of tobacco on the nose. It's crisp and fresh on the sip, where more flavors of red cherry and anise meet with thyme and bay leaf.

title: Longoria 2014 Rita's Crown Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Managing to be both brisk and rounded on the nose, this bottling by veteran Rick Longoria shows ripe nectarine, sea salt, white peach and lime rind aromas. The palate is quite flinty at first, then opens to light Meyer lemon juice, Gravenstin apple flesh, sea salt, white sesame, chive and jasmine flavors. Excellent now, but will drink excellently all the way through 2024.

title: Louis Latour 2014 La Garenne Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)
description: This wine has all the tight minerality of the appellation, surrounded by delicious, ripe yellow and white fruits. The wood aging is still there although balanced with the richness and the intensity of the wine. It is going to develop well. Drink from 2020.

title: Hudson Vineyards 2014 Pick Up Sticks Red (Carneros)
description: This is an estate-grown blend of 80% Grenache, 15% Syrah and 5% Viognier from the great vineyard site, savory in spicy white pepper, blueberry and a persistence of cinnamon and clove. Floral aromas and a delicate texture provide a memorable experience on the palate, finishing in a tease of tobacco.

title: Domaine Ellevin 2014 Vaucoupin Premier Cru  (Chablis)
description: Crisp and firmly structured, this wine is textured with acidity and minerality. The apple, pear and lime flavors are shot through with this steely character that is still integrating in this concentrated wine. Drink from 2018.

title: Domaine Faiveley 2014 Clos de l'Ecu Premier Cru Monopole  (Beaune)
description: A generous wine, this is packed with red fruits as well as firmly structured. It conveys the fresh acidity of the year, with fine smoky tannins. It will be an impressive wine. Drink from 2020.
designation: Clos de l'Ecu Premier Cru Monopole

title: Donkey & Goat 2015 Linda Vista Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: From a fine site farmed by Steve Matthiasson, this crisp, delightfully compelling white is tart and tangy in orange and lime. Tight and youthful, it shows complexity and concentration while a steely elegance weighs in, ultimately allowing the wine to show an elegance of site and style.

title: Mi Terruño 2011 Mayacaba Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Blackberry and toasty aromas show rich notes of fig and oaky coconut. Wall-to-wall tannins make for a firm mouthfeel, while balsamic, earthy berry and cedar flavors feature a shot of red raspberry for balance. Drink this integrated Malbec through 2022.

title: Albert Morot 2014 Les Cent Vignes Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: Rich and juicy, this wine holds excellent potential. With its ripe red-berry fruit, balanced tannins and acidity, and spice from the wood aging, it will become a concentrated wine. Drink from 2020.
